oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Prediction of organizational-effectiveness as a function of type of organizational-structure
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: BHARGAVA, S
SINHA, B
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Increasing problems of work inefficiency, pending work, diffusion of responsibility, and bureaucracy in organizations are partly due to the organizations' mechanistic design, which is based on a hierarchical structure. An alternative self-organizing design based on a heterarchical structure has been put forward in recent years. This study examined the prediction of four components of organizational effectiveness of organizations varying in structure. Participants were final-year university engineering students and engineers working in a large public enterprise in India. Comparative analysis has shown significant improvement in organizational effectiveness under a heterarchical structure. The results are discussed within the structural perspective of the organizations.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: NATIONAL SEMINAR ON APPLIED SOCIAL PSYCHOLOGY IN INDIA,BHOPAL, INDIA,FEB 10-12, 1987
